stdLibs.name: auth
stdLibs.summary: This package provides listener Basic authentication providers, which can be used to authenticate the provided credentials against a file user store or an LDAP user store, and a client Basic authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate against an external endpoint.

stdLibs.name: awslambda
stdLibs.summary: This module offers the capabilities of creating AWS Lambda functions using Ballerina.

stdLibs.name: azure_functions
stdLibs.summary: This module provides an annotation based Azure Functions extension implementation for Ballerina.

stdLibs.name: cache
stdLibs.summary: This package provides APIs for handle caching in Ballerina. It consists of a default implementation based on the map data structure. It also provides a default cache eviction policy object, which is based on the LRU eviction algorithm.

stdLibs.name: cloud
stdLibs.summary: This module offers an annotation based Kubernetes extension implementation for ballerina.

stdLibs.name: crypto
stdLibs.summary: This package provides the necessary utilities that are required to hash content using different hashing mechanisms and algorithms.

stdLibs.name: docker
stdLibs.summary: This module offers an annotation based docker extension implementation for Ballerina.

stdLibs.name: email
stdLibs.summary: This package contains functions to perform email operations such as sending and reading emails using the SMTP, POP3, and IMAP4 protocols.

stdLibs.name: encoding
stdLibs.summary: This package provides the necessary utilities, which are required to encode and decode content using different URL encoding mechanisms and algorithms.

stdLibs.name: file
stdLibs.summary:
This package contains functions to perform file system based operations such as create, delete, rename the
file/directory, and retrieve metadata of the file.

stdLibs.name: ftp
stdLibs.summary: This module provides an FTP client and an FTP server listener implementation to facilitate an FTP connection to a remote location.

stdLibs.name: graphql
stdLibs.summary: This package provides an implementation for connecting and interacting with GraphQL endpoints.

stdLibs.name: grpc
stdLibs.summary: This package provides support for the gRPC messaging protocol. gRPC is an inter-process communication technology that allows you to connect, invoke and operate distributed heterogeneous applications as easily as making a local function call. The gRPC protocol is layered over HTTP/2 and It uses Protocol Buffers for marshaling/unmarshaling messages. This makes gRPC, highly efficient on wire and a simple service definition framework.

stdLibs.name: http
stdLibs.summary: This package provides an implementation for connecting and interacting with HTTP and HTTP2 endpoints. The package facilitates two types of network entry points as ‘Client’ and ‘Listener’.

stdLibs.name: io
stdLibs.summary: The following diagram depicts the overview architecture of the I/O package.

stdLibs.name: java.arrays
stdLibs.summary: This package provides APIs to create new Java array instances, get elements from arrays, set elements, etc.

stdLibs.name: java.jdbc
stdLibs.summary:
This package provides the functionality required to access and manipulate data stored in any type of relational database
that is accessible via Java Database Connectivity (JDBC).

stdLibs.name: jsonutils
stdLibs.summary: This package provides utility functions to manipulate the built-in "json" data type. It provides APIs to convert an "xml" to a "json" or convert a "table" to a "json".

stdLibs.name: jwt
stdLibs.summary: This package provides a listener JWT authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate the provided credentials against the provided JWT validator configurations, and a client self-signed JWT authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate against an external endpoint with a self-signed JWT issued against the provided JWT issuer configurations. Also, this module provides the functionality related to issuing and validating a JWT.

stdLibs.name: log
stdLibs.summary: This package provides a basic API for logging.

stdLibs.name: mime
stdLibs.summary:
This package provides functions to encapsulate multiple body parts such as attachments into a single message. The
communication of such messages follow the MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) specification as specified in
the "RFC 2045 standard" (https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2045.txt).

stdLibs.name: mysql
stdLibs.summary: This Package provides the functionality required to access and manipulate data stored in a MySQL database.

stdLibs.name: oauth2
stdLibs.summary: This package provides a listener OAuth2 authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate the provided credentials against an introspection endpoint, and a client OAuth2 authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate against an external endpoint.

stdLibs.name: openapi
stdLibs.summary: The OpenAPI tools provide the following capabilities.

stdLibs.name: os
stdLibs.summary: This package provides functions to retrieve information about the operating system and the current users of the operating system. The "os:exec" method creates the "os:Process" object, which can control and obtain information about a Ballerina process.

stdLibs.name: random
stdLibs.summary: This package provides functions related to random number generation. The "random:createDecimal" method generates a random decimal number between 0.0 and 1.0. The "random:createIntInRange" method generates a random number between the given start(inclusive) and end(exclusive) values.

stdLibs.name: reflect
stdLibs.summary: This package provides utility methods for obtaining reflective information about the Ballerina runtime.

stdLibs.name: regex
stdLibs.summary: This package provides the following regex utility functions.

stdLibs.name: runtime
stdLibs.summary: This package provides functions to interact with the Ballerina runtime invocation context.

stdLibs.name: sql
stdLibs.summary:
This Package provides the common interface and functionality to interact with a database. The corresponding database
clients can be created by using specific database packages such as "MySQL" or using the Java Database Connectivity
package "JDBC".

stdLibs.name: task
stdLibs.summary:
This package provides the functionality to configure and manage Task Listeners and Task Schedulers.
Task Listeners and Task Schedulers can be used to perform tasks periodically.

stdLibs.name: tcp
stdLibs.summary: This package provides an implementation for sending/receiving messages to/from another application process (local or remote) for both connection-oriented protocols.

stdLibs.name: time
stdLibs.summary: This package provides implementations related to time, date, time zones, and durations.

stdLibs.name: udp
stdLibs.summary: This package provides an implementation for sending/receiving messages to/from another application process (local or remote) for connectionless protocols.

stdLibs.name: uuid
stdLibs.summary: This package provides functions related to UUID (Universally unique identifier). For an example on the usage of the operations, see the "UUID Example" (https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/uuid.html).

stdLibs.name: websocket
stdLibs.summary: This package provides an implementation for connecting and interacting with WebSocket endpoints. The package facilitates three types of network entry points as ‘Client’, ‘AsyncClient’, and ‘Listener’.

stdLibs.name: websub
stdLibs.summary: This package contains an implementation of the W3C "WebSub" (https://www.w3.org/TR/websub/) recommendation, which facilitates a push-based content delivery/notification mechanism between publishers and subscribers.

stdLibs.name: websubhub
stdLibs.summary:
W3C "WebSub" (https://w3c.github.io/websub/) is a recommendation, which facilitates a push-based content delivery / notification mechanism
between publishers and subscribers.

stdLibs.name: xmlutils
stdLibs.summary:
This package provides utility functions to manipulate the built-in "xml" data type.
It provides APIs to convert a "json" to an "xml" or convert a "table" to an "xml".

stdLibs.name: xslt
stdLibs.summary: This package provides a function to transform the XML content to another XML/HTML/plain text using XSL transformations.

modules.summary: This module provides the API for Java interoperability in Ballerina. It includes a set of Ballerina annotations with which Java constructors, methods, and fields can provide implementations of Ballerina functions with external function bodies.
modules.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides the API for Java interoperability in Ballerina. It includes a set of Ballerina annotations with which Java constructors, methods, and fields can provide implementations of Ballerina functions with external function bodies.  

For information on the operations, which you can perform with the Java module, see the below **Functions**. For examples on the usage of the operations, see the following.
- [Create Java Objects Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/create-java-objects.html)
- [Invoke Java Methods Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/invoke-java-methods.html) 
- [Access/Mutate Java Fields Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/access-mutate-java-fields.html)
- [Java Varargs Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/java-varargs.html)
- [Overloaded Methods/Constructors Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/overloaded-methods-constructors.html)
- [Java Exceptions Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/java-exceptions.html)

```ballerina
# handle header = java:fromString("Content-Type");
# ```

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Java class

returnParameters.description: The Java Class object for the class with the given name

functions.name: getClass
functions.description:
Returns a `handle`, which refers to the Java Class object associated with the class or interface with the given
string name.
```ballerina
# handle|error intClass = java:getClass("int");
# ```

This function performs a Java `class.forName(name)` except for the following cases:

| Name     |   Output                                                      |
|:---------|:--------------------------------------------------------------|
| boolean  |   Java Class instance representing the primitive type boolean |
| byte     |   Java Class instance representing the primitive type byte    |
| char     |   Java Class instance representing the primitive type char    |
| short    |   Java Class instance representing the primitive type short   |
| int      |   Java Class instance representing the primitive type int     |
| long     |   Java Class instance representing the primitive type long    |
| float    |   Java Class instance representing the primitive type float   |
| double   |   Java Class instance representing the primitive type double  |

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The `handle` of which the referred value is to be tested with Java null

returnParameters.description: `true` if this handle refers to Java null

functions.name: isNull
functions.description:
Returns `true` if this handle refers to Java null.
```ballerina
# boolean status = java:isNull(value);
# ```

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The `handle` of which the referred value is to be converted to a Ballerina `string`

returnParameters.description:
The Ballerina `string` representation of the Java object referred by the `handle` or else
           returns `()` if the `handle` refers to Java null

functions.name: toString
functions.description:
Returns a Ballerina `string` representation of the Java object referred by the `handle`.
If the `handle` refers to Java null, then this function returns a `nil` value.
```ballerina
# string? version = java:toString(versionProperty);
# ```

annotations.name: Binding
Constructor
annotations.description:
Describes a Java constructor, which provides an implementation of a Ballerina function of which the body is marked as
`external`. If the Ballerina function body is marked as `external`, it means that the implementation of the
function is not provided in the Ballerina source module.

The following code snippet shows an example usage of this annotation. Here, the `newJavaLinkedList` Ballerina function's
implementation is provided by the default constructor of the `java.util.LinkedList` class.
```ballerina
# function newJavaLinkedList() returns handle = @java:Constructor {
#      'class: "java.util.LinkedList"
# } external;
# ```

annotations.name: FieldGet
annotations.description:
Describes a Java Field access, which provides an implementation of a Ballerina function of which the body is marked as
`external`.
```ballerina
# function getError() returns handle = @java:FieldGet {
#     name:"err",
#     'class:"java/lang/System"
# } external;
# ```

annotations.name: FieldSet
annotations.description:
Describes a Java Field mutate, which provides an implementation of a Ballerina function of which the body is marked as
`external`.
```ballerina
# function setContractId(handle contractId) = @java:FieldSet {
#   name:"contractId",
#   'class:"org/lang/impl/JavaFieldAccessMutate"
# } external;
# ```

annotations.name: Method
annotations.description:
Describes a Java method, which provides an implementation of a Ballerina function of which the body is marked as
`external`. If the Ballerina function body is marked as `external`, it means that the implementation of the
function is not provided in the Ballerina source module.

The following code snippet shows an example usage of this annotation. Here, the `getUUID` Ballerina function's
implementation is provided by the `java.util.UUID.randomUUID` static method.
```ballerina
# function getUUID() returns handle = @java:Method {
#     name: "randomUUID",
#     'class: "java.util.UUID"
# } external;
# ```
The `name` field is optional. If it is not provided, the name of the Java method is inferred
from the Ballerina function.

errors.name: JavaClassNotFoundError
errors.description: Represents a `JavaError` with the message and the cause.

modules.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides lang library list operations defined by the language specification 2020R1.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each member

returnParameters.description: new array containing result of applying `func` to each member of `arr` in order

functions.name: 'map
functions.description: Applies a function to each member of an array and returns an array of the results.

returnParameters.description: array of index, member pairs

functions.name: enumerate
functions.description: Returns a new array consisting of index and member pairs.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a predicate to apply to each member to test whether it should be selected

returnParameters.description: new array only containing members of `arr` for which `func` evaluates to true

functions.name: filter
functions.description: Selects the members from an array for which a function returns true.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each member

functions.name: forEach
functions.description:
Applies a function to each member of an array.
The parameter `func` is applied to each member of array `arr` in order.

returnParameters.description: the byte array or error

functions.name: fromBase16
functions.description:
Returns the byte array that a string represents in Base16.
`str` must consist of the characters `0..9`, `A..F`, `a..f`
and whitespace as allowed by a Ballerina Base16Literal.

returnParameters.description: the byte array or error

functions.name: fromBase64
functions.description:
Returns the byte array that a string represents in Base64.
`str` must consist of the characters `A..Z`, `a..z`, `0..9`, `+`, `/`, `=`
and whitespace as allowed by a Ballerina Base64Literal.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: index to start the search from

returnParameters.description: index of the member if found, else `()`

functions.name: indexOf
functions.description:
Returns the index of first member of `arr` that is equal to `val` if there is one.
Returns `()` if not found.
Equality is tested using `==`.

returnParameters.description: a new iterator object that will iterate over the members of `arr`.

functions.name: iterator
functions.description: Returns an iterator over an array.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: index to start searching backwards from

returnParameters.description: index of the member if found, else `()`

functions.name: lastIndexOf
functions.description:
Returns the index of last member of `arr` that is equal to `val` if there is one.
Returns `()` if not found.
Equality is tested using `==`.

returnParameters.description: number of members in `arr`

functions.name: length
functions.description: Returns the number of members of an array.

returnParameters.description: removed member

functions.name: pop
functions.description:
Removes and returns the last member of an array.
The array must not be empty.

parameters.name: vals
parameters.description: values to add to the end of the array

functions.name: push
functions.description: Adds values to the end of an array.

parameters.name: initial
parameters.description: initial value for the first argument of combining parameter `func`

returnParameters.description:
result of combining the members of `arr` using `func`
For example
```
# reduce([1, 2, 3], function (int total, int n) returns int { return total + n; }, 0)
# ```
is the same as `sum(1, 2, 3)`.

functions.name: reduce
functions.description:
Combines the members of an array using a combining function.
The combining function takes the combined value so far and a member of the array,
and returns a new combined value.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: index of member to be removed from `arr`

returnParameters.description:
the member of `arr` that was at `index`
This removes the member of `arr` with index `index` and returns it.
It panics if there is no such member.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes a member of an array.

parameters.name: arr
parameters.description:
the array
 Panics if any member cannot be removed.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: Removes all members of an array.

returnParameters.description: `arr` with its members in reverse order

functions.name: reverse
functions.description: Reverses the order of the members of an array.

parameters.name: arr
parameters.description: the array of which to change the length

functions.name: setLength
functions.description: Changes the length of an array.

returnParameters.description: the value that was the first member of the array

functions.name: shift
functions.description:
Removes and returns first member of an array.
The array must not be empty.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: index of first member to include in the slice

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.description: index of first member not to include in the slice

returnParameters.description: array slice within specified range

functions.name: slice
functions.description: Returns a subarray starting from `startIndex` (inclusive) to `endIndex` (exclusive).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: function that returns a key to use to sort the members

returnParameters.description: a new array consisting of the members of `arr` in sorted order

functions.name: sort
functions.description:
Sorts an array.
If the member type of the array is not sorted, then the `key` function
must be specified.
Sorting works the same as with the `sort` clause of query expressions.

returnParameters.description: Base16 string representation

functions.name: toBase16
functions.description:
Returns the string that is the Base16 representation of an array of bytes.
The representation is the same as used by a Ballerina Base16Literal.
The result will contain only characters  `0..9`, `a..f`.
There will be no whitespace in the returned string.

returnParameters.description: Base64 string representation

functions.name: toBase64
functions.description:
Returns the string that is the Base64 representation of an array of bytes.
The representation is the same as used by a Ballerina Base64Literal.
The result will contain only characters  `A..Z`, `a..z`, `0..9`, `+`, `/` and `=`.
There will be no whitespace in the returned string.

parameters.name: arr
parameters.description: The array from which the stream is created

returnParameters.description: The stream representation of the array `arr`

functions.name: toStream
functions.description: Returns a stream from the given array.

parameters.name: vals
parameters.description: values to add to the start of the array

functions.name: unshift
functions.description:
Adds values to the start of an array.
The values newly added to the array will be in the same order
as they are in `vals`.

modules.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides lang library operations on `boolean` values defined by the language specification 2020R1.

returnParameters.description: boolean that `s` represents, or an error if there is no such boolean

functions.name: fromString
functions.description:
Converts a string to a boolean.
Returns the boolean of which `s` is a string representation.
The accepted representations are `true`, `false`
(in any combination of lower- and upper-case),
and also `1` for true and `0` for `false`.
This is the inverse of `value:toString` applied to a `boolean`.

modules.summary: This module provides lang library operations on "decimal" values defined by the language specification 2020R1.
modules.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides lang library operations on `decimal` values defined by the language specification 2020R1.

returnParameters.description: absolute value of `x`

functions.name: abs
functions.description: IEEE abs operation.

returnParameters.description: smallest (closest to -∞) decimal value not less than `x` that is a mathematical integer

functions.name: ceiling
functions.description: Rounds a decimal up to the closest integral value.

returnParameters.description: largest (closest to +∞) decimal value not greater than `x` that is a mathematical integer.

functions.name: floor
functions.description: Rounds a decimal down to the closest integral value.

returnParameters.description: decimal representation of the argument or error

functions.name: fromString
functions.description:
Return the decimal value represented by `s`.
`s` must follow the syntax of DecimalFloatingPointNumber as defined by the Ballerina specification
with the following modifications
- the DecimalFloatingPointLiteral may have a leading `+` or `-` sign
- a FloatingPointTypeSuffix is not allowed
This is the inverse of `value:toString` applied to an `decimal`.

returnParameters.description: maximum value of `x` and all the `xs`

functions.name: max
functions.description: Maximum of one or more decimal values.

returnParameters.description: minimum value of `x` and all the `xs`.

functions.name: min
functions.description: Minimum of one or more decimal values

returnParameters.description: closest decimal value to `x` that is a mathematical integer

functions.name: round
functions.description:
Round a decimal to the closest integral value.
Returns the decimal value that is a mathematical integer and closest to `x`.
If there are two such values, choose the one that is even
(this is the round-to-nearest rounding mode, which is the default for IEEE
and for Ballerina).
Same as Java Math.rint method
Same as .NET Math.Round method
IEEE 754 roundToIntegralTiesToEven operation
Note that `<int>x` is the same as `<int>x.round()`

returnParameters.description: sum of all the `xs`; 0 if `xs` is empty

functions.name: sum
functions.description: Sum of zero or more decimal values.

modules.summary: This module provides lang library operations on "float" values defined by the language specification 2020R1.
modules.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides lang library operations on `float` values defined by the language specification 2020R1.

returnParameters.description: absolute value of `x`

functions.name: abs
functions.description: IEEE abs operation.

returnParameters.description: the arccosine of `x` in radians

functions.name: acos
functions.description:
Returns the arccosine of a float value.
Corresponds to IEEE acos operation

returnParameters.description: the arcsine of `x` in radians

functions.name: asin
functions.description:
Returns the arcsine of a float value.
Corresponds to IEEE asin operation.

returnParameters.description: the arctangent of `x` in radians

functions.name: atan
functions.description:
Returns the arctangent of a float value.
Corresponds to IEEE atan operation.

returnParameters.description:
the angle in radians from the positive x-axis to the point
  whose Cartesian coordinates are `(x, y)`

functions.name: atan2
functions.description:
Performs the 2-argument arctangent operation.
Corresponds IEEE atan2(y, x) operation.

returnParameters.description: cube root of `x`

functions.name: cbrt
functions.description:
Returns the cube root of a float value.
Corresponds to IEEE rootn(x, 3) operation.

returnParameters.description: smallest (closest to -∞) decimal value not less than `x` that is a mathematical integer

functions.name: ceiling
functions.description: Rounds a float up to the closest integral value.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: float value, specifying an angle in radians

returnParameters.description: the cosine of `x`

functions.name: cos
functions.description:
Returns the cosine of a float value.
Corresponds to IEEE cos operation.

returnParameters.description: hyperbolic cosine of `x`

functions.name: cosh
functions.description:
Returns the hyperbolic cosine of a float value.
Corresponds to IEEE cosh operation.

returnParameters.description: Euler's number raised to the power `x`

functions.name: exp
functions.description:
Raises Euler's number to a power.
Corresponds to IEEE exp operation.

returnParameters.description: largest (closest to +∞) float value not greater than `x` that is a mathematical integer.

functions.name: floor
functions.description: Rounds a float down to the closest integral value.

returnParameters.description: `x` bit pattern as a float

functions.name: fromBitsInt
functions.description:
Returns the float that is represented in IEEE 64-bit floating point by `x`.
All bit patterns that IEEE defines to be NaNs will all be mapped to the single float NaN value.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: hexadecimal floating point hex string representation

returnParameters.description: float value or error

functions.name: fromHexString
functions.description:
Return the float value represented by `s`.
`s` must follow the syntax of HexFloatingPointLiteral as defined by the Ballerina specification
with the following modifications
- the HexFloatingPointLiteral may have a leading `+` or `-` sign
- `NaN` is allowed
- `Infinity` is allowed with an optional leading `+` or `-` sign

returnParameters.description: float value or error

functions.name: fromString
functions.description:
Return the float value represented by `s`.
`s` must follow the syntax of DecimalFloatingPointNumber as defined by the Ballerina specification
with the following modifications
- the DecimalFloatingPointNumber may have a leading `+` or `-` sign
- `NaN` is allowed
- `Infinity` is allowed with an optional leading `+` or `-` sign
- a FloatingPointTypeSuffix is not allowed
This is the inverse of `value:toString` applied to an `float`.

returnParameters.description: true if `x` is finite, i.e. neither NaN nor +∞ nor -∞

functions.name: isFinite
functions.description:
Tests whether a float is finite.
Exactly one of isFinite, isInfinite and IsNaN will be true for any float value

returnParameters.description: true if `x` is either +∞ or -∞

functions.name: isInfinite
functions.description:
Tests whether a float is infinite.
Exactly one of isFinite, isInfinite and IsNaN will be true for any float value

returnParameters.description: true if `x` is NaN

functions.name: isNaN
functions.description:
Tests whether a float is NaN.
Exactly one of isFinite, isInfinite and IsNaN will be true for any float value.

returnParameters.description: natural logarithm of `x`

functions.name: log
functions.description:
Returns the natural logarithm of a float value
Corresponds to IEEE log operation.

returnParameters.description: base 10 logarithm of `x`

functions.name: log10
functions.description:
Returns the base 10 logarithm of a float value.
Corresponds to IEEE log10 operation.

returnParameters.description: maximum value of all the `xs`

functions.name: max
functions.description:
Maximum of zero or more float values.
Result is -∞ if no args
NaN if any arg is NaN

returnParameters.description: minimum value of all the `xs`

functions.name: min
functions.description:
Minimum of zero or more float values.
Result is +∞ if no args
Result is NaN if any arg is NaN

returnParameters.description: `x` raised to the power of `y`

functions.name: pow
functions.description:
Raises one float value to the power of another float values.
Corresponds to IEEE pow(x, y) operation.

returnParameters.description: closest float value to `x` that is a mathematical integer

functions.name: round
functions.description:
Round a float value to the closest integral value.
Returns the float value that is a mathematical integer and closest to `x`.
If there are two such values, choose the one that is even
(this is the round-to-nearest rounding mode, which is the default for IEEE and for Ballerina).
Same as Java Math.rint method
Same as .NET Math.Round method
IEEE roundToIntegralTiesToEven operation
Note that `<int>x` is the same as `<int>x.round()`

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: float value, specifying an angle in radians

returnParameters.description: the sine of `x`

functions.name: sin
functions.description:
Returns the sine of a float value.
Corresponds to IEEE sin operation.

returnParameters.description: hyperbolic sine of `x`

functions.name: sinh
functions.description:
Returns the hyperbolic sine of a float value.
Corresponds to IEEE sinh operation.

returnParameters.description: square root of `x`

functions.name: sqrt
functions.description:
Returns the square root of a float value.
Corresponds to IEEE squareRoot operation.

returnParameters.description: sum of all the `xs`, +0.0 if `xs` is empty

functions.name: sum
functions.description:
Sum of zero or more float values.
Result is NaN if any arg is NaN

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: float value, specifying an angle in radians

returnParameters.description: the tangent of `x`

functions.name: tan
functions.description:
Returns the tangent of a float value.
Corresponds to IEEE tan operation

returnParameters.description: hyperbolic tangent of `x`

functions.name: tanh
functions.description:
Returns the hyperbolic tangent of a float value.
Corresponds to IEEE tanh operation.

returnParameters.description: `x` bit pattern as an int

functions.name: toBitsInt
functions.description: Returns IEEE 64-bit binary floating point format representation of `x` as an int.

returnParameters.description: hexadecimal floating point hex string representation

functions.name: toHexString
functions.description:
Returns a string that represents `x` as a hexadecimal floating point number.
The returned string will comply to the grammar of HexFloatingPointLiteral
in the Ballerina spec with the following modifications:
- it will have a leading `-` sign if negative
- positive infinity will be represented by `Infinity`
- negative infinity will be represented by `-Infinity`
- NaN will be represented by `NaN`
The representation includes `0x` for finite numbers.

modules.summary: This module provides lang library operations on "int" values defined by the language specification 2020R1.
modules.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides lang library operations on `int` values defined by the language specification 2020R1.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: int value to be operated on

returnParameters.description: absolute value of `n`

functions.name: abs
functions.description: Returns absolute value of an int.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: hexadecimal string representation of int value

returnParameters.description: int value or error

functions.name: fromHexString
functions.description:
Returns the integer that `s` represents in hexadecimal.
Both uppercase A-F and lowercase a-f are allowed.
It may start with an optional `+` or `-` sign.
No `0x` or `0X` prefix is allowed.
Returns an error if the `s` is not in an allowed format.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: string representation of a integer value

returnParameters.description: int representation of the argument or error

functions.name: fromString
functions.description:
Returns the integer that `s` represents in decimal.
Returns error if `s` is not the decimal representation of an integer.
The first character may be `+` or `-`.
This is the inverse of `value:toString` applied to an `int`.

returnParameters.description: maximum value of value of `x` and all the `xs`

functions.name: max
functions.description: Maximum of one or more int values.

returnParameters.description: minimum value of `n` and all the `ns`

functions.name: min
functions.description: Minimum of one or more int values

returnParameters.description: sum of all the `ns`; 0 is `ns` is empty

functions.name: sum
functions.description: Returns sum of zero or more int values.

returnParameters.description: hexadecimal string representation of int value

functions.name: toHexString
functions.description:
Returns representation of `n` as hexdecimal string.
There is no `0x` prefix. Lowercase letters a-f are used.
Negative numbers will have a `-` prefix. No sign for
non-negative numbers.

modules.summary: This module provides lang library map operations defined by the language specification 2020R1.
modules.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides lang library map operations defined by the language specification 2020R1.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each member

returnParameters.description: new map containing result of applying parameter `func` to each member

functions.name: 'map
functions.description:
Applies a function each member of a map and returns a map of the result.
The resulting map will have the same keys as the argument map.

returnParameters.description: a new map of [key, member] pairs

functions.name: entries
functions.description: Returns a map containing [key, member] pair as the value for each key.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a predicate to apply to each element to test whether it should be included

returnParameters.description: new map containing members for which `func` evaluates to true

functions.name: filter
functions.description: Selects the members from a map for which a function returns true.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each member

functions.name: forEach
functions.description:
Applies a function to each member of a map.
The parameter `func` is applied to each member of `m`.

returnParameters.description: member with key `k`

functions.name: get
functions.description:
Returns the member of map `m` with key `k`.
This for use in a case where it is known that the map has a specific key,
and accordingly panics if `m` does not have a member with key `k`.

returnParameters.description: true if m has a member with key `k`

functions.name: hasKey
functions.description: Tests whether m has a member with key `k`.

returnParameters.description: a new iterator object that will iterate over the members of `m`

functions.name: iterator
functions.description:
Returns an iterator over a map.
The iterator will iterate over the members of the map not the keys.
The `entries` function can be used to iterate over the keys and members together.
The `keys` function can be used to iterator over just the keys.

returnParameters.description: a new list of all keys

functions.name: keys
functions.description: Returns a list of all the keys of map `m`.

returnParameters.description: number of members in `m`

functions.name: length
functions.description: Returns number of members of a map.

parameters.name: initial
parameters.description: initial value for the first argument of combining parameter `func`

returnParameters.description: result of combining the members of `m` using `func`

functions.name: reduce
functions.description:
Combines the members of a map using a combining function.
The combining function takes the combined value so far and a member of the map,
and returns a new combined value.

returnParameters.description:
the member of `m` that had key `k`
This removed the member of `m` with key `k` and returns it.
It panics if there is no such member.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes a member of a map.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description:
Removes all members of a map.
This panics if any member cannot be removed.

functions.name: removeIfHasKey
functions.description: Removes a member of a map with a given key, if the map has member with the key.

returnParameters.description: an array whose members are the members of `m`

functions.name: toArray
functions.description: Returns a list of all the members of a map.

modules.summary: This module provides lang library string operations defined by the language specification 2020R1.
modules.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides lang library string operations defined by the language specification 2020R1.

returnParameters.description:
a string consisting of all of `strs` concatenated in order
    with `separator` in between them

functions.name: 'join
functions.description: Joins zero or more strings together with a separator.

parameters.name: str1
parameters.description: the first string to be compared

parameters.name: str2
parameters.description: the second string to be compared

returnParameters.description:
an int that is less than, equal to or greater than zero,
   according as `str1` is less than, equal to or greater than `str2`

functions.name: codePointCompare
functions.description:
Lexicographically compares strings using their Unicode code points.
This orders strings in a consistent and well-defined way,
but the ordering will often not be consistent with cultural expectations
for sorted order.

returnParameters.description: concatenation of all of the `strs`; empty string if `strs` is empty

functions.name: concat
functions.description: Concatenates zero or more strings.

returnParameters.description: true if `str` ends with `substr`; false otherwise

functions.name: endsWith
functions.description: Tests whether a string ends with another string.

parameters.name: str1
parameters.description: the first string to be compared

parameters.name: str2
parameters.description: the second string to be compared

returnParameters.description:
true if `str1` is the same as `str2`, treating upper-case and lower-case
ASCII letters as the same; false, otherwise

functions.name: equalsIgnoreCaseAscii
functions.description:
Tests whether two strings are the same, ignoring the case of ASCII characters.
A character in the range a-z is treated the same as the corresponding character in the range A-Z.

returnParameters.description: `bytes` converted to string or error

functions.name: fromBytes
functions.description: Constructs a string from its UTF-8 representation in `bytes`.

parameters.name: codePoint
parameters.description: an int specifying a code point

returnParameters.description:
a single character string whose code point is `codePoint`; or an error
if `codePoint` is not a valid code point

functions.name: fromCodePointInt
functions.description:
Constructs a single character string from a code point.
An int is a valid code point if it is in the range 0 to 0x10FFFF inclusive,
but not in the range 0xD800 or 0xDFFF inclusive.

parameters.name: codePoints
parameters.description: an array of ints, each specifying a code point

returnParameters.description:
a string with a character for each code point in `codePoints`; or an error
if any member of `codePoints` is not a valid code point

functions.name: fromCodePointInts
functions.description:
Constructs a string from an array of code points.
An int is a valid code point if it is in the range 0 to 0x10FFFF inclusive,
but not in the range 0xD800 or 0xDFFF inclusive.

returnParameters.description: the Unicode code point of the character at `index` in `str`

functions.name: getCodePoint
functions.description: Returns the code point of a character in a string.

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: the string in which to search

returnParameters.description:
`true` if there is an occurrence of `substr` in `str` at an index >= `startIndex`,
   or `false` otherwise

functions.name: includes
functions.description: Tests whether a string includes another string.

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: the string in which to search

returnParameters.description:
index of the first occurrence of `substr` in `str` that is >= `startIndex`,
   or `()` if there is no such occurrence

functions.name: indexOf
functions.description: Finds the first occurrence of one string in another string.

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: the string to be iterated over

returnParameters.description: a new iterator object

functions.name: iterator
functions.description:
Returns an iterator over the string.
The iterator will yield the substrings of length 1 in order.

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: the string in which to search

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: index to start searching backwards from

returnParameters.description:
index of the last occurrence of `substr` in `str` that is <= `startIndex`,
   or `()` if there is no such occurrence

functions.name: lastIndexOf
functions.description: Finds the last occurrence of one string in another string.

returnParameters.description: the number of characters (code points) in `str`

functions.name: length
functions.description: Returns the length of the string.

returnParameters.description: true if `str` starts with `substr`; false otherwise

functions.name: startsWith
functions.description: Tests whether a string starts with another string.

returnParameters.description: substring consisting of characters with index >= startIndex and < endIndex

functions.name: substring
functions.description: Returns a substring of a string.

returnParameters.description: UTF-8 byte array

functions.name: toBytes
functions.description: Represents `str` as an array of bytes using UTF-8.

returnParameters.description: the code point of `ch`

functions.name: toCodePointInt
functions.description: Converts a single character string to a code point.

returnParameters.description: an array with a code point for each character of `str`

functions.name: toCodePointInts
functions.description: Converts a string to an array of code points.

returnParameters.description: `str` with any occurrences of A-Z converted to a-z

functions.name: toLowerAscii
functions.description:
Converts occurrences of A-Z to a-z.
Other characters are left unchanged.

returnParameters.description: `str` with any occurrences of a-z converted to A-Z

functions.name: toUpperAscii
functions.description:
Converts occurrences of a-z to A-Z.
Other characters are left unchanged.

returnParameters.description: `str` with leading or trailing ASCII white space characters removed

functions.name: trim
functions.description:
Removes ASCII white space characters from the start and end of a string.
The ASCII white space characters are 0x9...0xD, 0x20.

modules.summary: This module provides lang library operations on "table" values defined by the language specification 2020R1.
modules.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides lang library operations on `table` values defined by the language specification 2020R1.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each member

returnParameters.description: new table containing result of applying `func` to each member

functions.name: 'map
functions.description: Applies a function each member of a table and returns a table of the result.

functions.name: add
functions.description:
Adds a member `val` to table `t`.
It will be added as the last member.
It panics if `val` has the same key as an existing member of `t`,
or if `val` is inconsistent with the inherent type of `t`.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a predicate to apply to each member to test whether it should be included

returnParameters.description: new table containing members for which `func` evaluates to true

functions.name: filter
functions.description: Selects the members from a table for which a function returns true.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each member

functions.name: forEach
functions.description:
Applies a function to each member of a table.
The `func` is applied to each member of `t`.

returnParameters.description: member with key `k`

functions.name: get
functions.description:
Returns the member of table `t` with key `k`.
This for use in a case where it is known that the table has a specific key,
and accordingly panics if `t` does not have a member with key `k`.

returnParameters.description: true if `t` has a member with key `k`

functions.name: hasKey
functions.description: Tests whether `t` has a member with key `k`.

returnParameters.description: a new iterator object that will iterate over the members of `t`

functions.name: iterator
functions.description:
Returns an iterator over a table.
The iterator will iterate over the members of the table not the keys.
The `entries` function can be used to iterate over the keys and members together.
The `keys` function can be used to iterator over just the keys.

returnParameters.description: a new list of all keys

functions.name: keys
functions.description: Returns a list of all the keys of table `t`.

returnParameters.description: number of members in `t`

functions.name: length
functions.description: Returns number of members of a table.

parameters.name: t
parameters.description: the table with a key of type int

returnParameters.description:
an integer not yet used as a key
This is maximum used key value + 1, or 0 if no key used
XXX should it be 0, if the maximum used key value is < 0?
Provides similar functionality to auto-increment

functions.name: nextKey
functions.description: Returns the next available integer key.

functions.name: put
functions.description:
Adds a member `val` to table `t`, replacing any member with the same key value.
If `val` replaces an existing member, it will have the same position
in the order of the members as the existing member;
otherwise, it will be added as the last member.
It panics if `val` is inconsistent with the inherent type of `t`.

parameters.name: initial
parameters.description: initial value for the first argument of combining `func`

returnParameters.description: result of combining the members of `t` using `func`

functions.name: reduce
functions.description:
Combines the members of a table using a combining function.
The combining function takes the combined value so far and a member of the table,
and returns a new combined value.

returnParameters.description:
the member of `t` that had key `k`
This removed the member of `t` with key `k` and returns it.
It panics if there is no such member.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes a member of a table.

modules.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides lang library operations on `transaction`s.

fields.name: xid
fields.description: Unique identifier for the transaction branch

fields.name: retryNumber
fields.description: The number of previous attempts in a sequence of retries

fields.name: prevAttempt
fields.description:
Information about the previous attempt in a sequence of retries.
This will be `()` if the `retryNumber` is 0.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: The time at which the transaction was started.

records.name: Info
records.description:
Information about a transaction that does not change
after the transaction is started.

returnParameters.description: the data, or `()` if no data has been set.

functions.name: getData
functions.description:
Retrieves data associated with the current transaction branch.
The data is set using `setData`.

functions.name: getInfo
functions.description:
Returns information about the transaction with
the specified xid.

returnParameters.description:
true if it is known that the transaction manager will,
when it makes the decision whether to commit or rollback, decide
to rollback

functions.name: getRollbackOnly
functions.description: Tells whether it is known that the transaction will be rolled back.

functions.name: info
functions.description: Returns information about the current transaction

parameters.name: handler
parameters.description: the function to be called on commit

functions.name: onCommit
functions.description: Adds a handler to be called if and when the global transaction commits.

parameters.name: handler
parameters.description: the function to be called on rollback

functions.name: onRollback
functions.description: Adds a handler to be called if and when the global transaction rolls back.

returnParameters.description: Prepared `Error` instance

functions.name: prepareError
functions.description: Log and prepare `error` as a `Error`.

functions.name: setData
functions.description: Associates some data with the current transaction branch.

functions.name: setRollbackOnly
functions.description:
Prevents the global transaction from committing successfully.
This ask the transaction manager that when it makes the decision
whether to commit or rollback, it should decide to rollback.

errors.name: Error
errors.description: Type of error returned by commit action.

modules.summary: This module provides lang library operations common to all values defined by the language specification 2020R1.
modules.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides lang library operations common to all values defined by the language specification 2020R1.

returnParameters.description: clone of `v`

functions.name: clone
functions.description:
Returns a clone of `v`.
A clone is a deep copy that does not copy immutable subtrees.
A clone can therefore safely be used concurrently with the original.
It corresponds to the Clone(v) operation,
defined in the Ballerina Language Specification.

returnParameters.description: immutable clone of `v`

functions.name: cloneReadOnly
functions.description:
Returns a clone of `v` that is read-only, i.e. immutable.
It corresponds to the ImmutableClone(v) operation,
defined in the Ballerina Language Specification.

parameters.name: t
parameters.description: the type for the cloned to be constructed

returnParameters.description:
a new value that belongs to `t`, or an error if this cannot be done
When `v` is a structural value, the inherent type of the value to be constructed
comes from `t`. When `t` is a union, it must be possible to determine which
member of the union to use for the inherent type by following the same rules
that are used by list constructor expressions and mapping constructor expressions
with the contextually expected type. If not, then an error is returned.
The `constructFrom` operation is recursively applied to each member of `v` using
the type descriptor that the inherent type requires for that member.
Like the Clone abstract operation, this does a deep copy, but differs in
the following respects:
- the inherent type of any structural values constructed comes from the specified
  type descriptor rather than the value being constructed
- the read-only bit of values and fields comes from the specified type descriptor
- the graph structure of `v` is not preserved; the result will always be a tree;
  an error will be returned if `v` has cycles
- immutable structural values are copied rather being returned as is; all
  structural values in the result will be mutable, except for error values
  (which are always immutable)
- numeric values can be converted using the NumericConvert abstract operation
- if a record type descriptor specifies default values, these will be used
  to supply any missing members

functions.name: cloneWithType
functions.description: Constructs a value with a specified type by cloning another value.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: the string to be parsed and evaluated

returnParameters.description:
the result of evaluating the parsed expression, or
an error if the string cannot be parsed
The subset of Ballerina expression syntax supported is that produced
by toBalString when applied to an anydata value.

functions.name: fromBalString
functions.description: Parses and evaluates a subset of Ballerina expression syntax.

returnParameters.description: `str` parsed to json or error

functions.name: fromJsonDecimalString
functions.description:
Parses a string in JSON format and returns the value that it represents.
All numbers in the JSON will be represented as decimal values.
Returns an error if the string cannot be parsed.

returnParameters.description: `str` parsed to json or error

functions.name: fromJsonFloatString
functions.description:
Parses a string in JSON format and returns the value that it represents.
All numbers in the JSON will be represented as float values.
Returns an error if the string cannot be parsed.

returnParameters.description: `str` parsed to json or error

functions.name: fromJsonString
functions.description:
Parses a string in JSON format and returns the the value that it represents.
All integer numbers in the JSON will be represented as integer values.
All decimal numbers except -0.0 in the JSON will be represent as decimal values.
-0.0 in the JSON will be represent as float value.
Returns an error if the string cannot be parsed.

returnParameters.description: value belonging to `t`, or error if this cannot be done

functions.name: fromJsonStringWithType
functions.description:
Converts a string in JSON format to a user-specified type.
This is a combination of `fromJsonString` followed by
`fromJsonWithType`.

returnParameters.description: value belonging to `t`, or error if this cannot be done

functions.name: fromJsonWithType
functions.description:
Converts a value of type json to a user-specified type.
This works the same as `cloneWithType`,
except that it also does the inverse of the conversions done by `toJson`.

returnParameters.description: true if read-only, false otherwise

functions.name: isReadOnly
functions.description:
Tests whether `v` is read-only, i.e. immutable
Returns true if read-only, false otherwise.

returnParameters.description:
the merge of `j1` with `j2` or an error if the merge fails
The merge of `j1` with `j2` is defined as follows:
- if `j1` is `()`, then the result is `j2`
- if `j2` is `()`, then the result is `j1`
- if `j1` is a mapping and `j2` is a mapping, then for each entry [k, j] in j2,
  set `j1[k]` to the merge of `j1[k]` with `j`
    - if `j1[k]` is undefined, then set `j1[k]` to `j`
    - if any merge fails, then the merge of `j1` with `j2` fails
    - otherwise, the result is `j1`.
- otherwise, the merge fails
If the merge fails, then `j1` is unchanged.

functions.name: mergeJson
functions.description: Merges two json values.

parameters.name: v
parameters.description: the value to be converted to a string

returnParameters.description:
a string resulting from the conversion
If `v` is anydata and does not have cycles, then the result will
conform to the grammar for a Ballerina expression and when evaluated
will result in a value that is == to v.
The details of the conversion are specified by the ToString abstract operation
defined in the Ballerina Language Specification, using the expression style.

functions.name: toBalString
functions.description: Converts a value to a string that describes the value in Ballerina syntax.

returnParameters.description:
representation of `v` as value of type json
This panics if `v` has cycles.

functions.name: toJson
functions.description:
Converts a value of type `anydata` to `json`.
This does a deep copy of `v` converting values that do
not belong to json into values that do.
A value of type `xml` is converted into a string as if
by the `toString` function.
A value of type `table` is converted into a list of
mappings one for each row.
The inherent type of arrays in the return value will be
`json[]` and of mappings will be `map<json>`.
A new copy is made of all structural values, including
immutable values.

returnParameters.description: string representation of json

functions.name: toJsonString
functions.description:
Returns the string that represents `v` in JSON format.
`v` is first converted to `json` as if by the `toJson` function.

parameters.name: v
parameters.description: the value to be converted to a string

returnParameters.description:
a string resulting from the conversion
The details of the conversion are specified by the ToString abstract operation
defined in the Ballerina Language Specification, using the direct style.

functions.name: toString
functions.description:
Performs a direct conversion of a value to a string.
The conversion is direct in the sense that when applied to a value that is already
a string it leaves the value unchanged.

types.name: Cloneable
types.description: The type of value to which `clone` and `cloneReadOnly` can be applied.

types.name: CloneableType
types.description:
A type parameter that is a subtype of `Cloneable`.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.

modules.summary: This module provides lang library operations on "xml" values defined by the language specification 2020R1.
modules.description:
## Module Overview

This module provides lang library operations on `xml` values defined by the language specification 2020R1.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each child or `item`

returnParameters.description: new xml value containing result of applying `func` to each child or `item`

functions.name: 'map
functions.description:
Applies a function to each item in an xml sequence, and returns an xml sequence of the results.
Each item is represented as a singleton value.

returnParameters.description:
xml sequence containing the children of each element x concatenated in order
This is equivalent to `elements(x).map(getChildren)`.

functions.name: children
functions.description:
Returns the children of elements in an xml value.
When `x` is of type Element, it is equivalent to `getChildren`.

parameters.name: xs
parameters.description: xml or string items to concatenate

returnParameters.description:
an xml sequence that is the concatenation of all the `xs`;
   an empty xml sequence if the `xs` are empty

functions.name: concat
functions.description: Concatenates xml and string values.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: the content of the comment to be constructed.

returnParameters.description: an xml sequence consisting of a comment with content `content`

functions.name: createComment
functions.description: Constructs an xml sequence consisting of only a comment item.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the new element

parameters.name: children
parameters.description: the children of the new element

returnParameters.description:
an xml sequence consisting of only a new xml element with name `name`,
  no attributes, and children `children`

functions.name: createElement
functions.description: Constructs an xml sequence consisting of only a new element item.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: the target part of the processing instruction to be constructed

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: the content part of the processing instruction to be constructed

returnParameters.description:
an xml sequence consisting of a processing instruction with target `target`
    and content `content`

functions.name: createProcessingInstruction
functions.description: Constructs an xml sequence consisting of only a processing instruction item.

returnParameters.description:
an xml sequence that is either empty or consists of one text item
The constructed sequence will be empty when the length of `chars` is zero.

functions.name: createText
functions.description: Constructs an xml sequence representing zero of more parsed characters.

parameters.name: nm
parameters.description: the expanded name of the elements to be selected, or `()` for all elements

returnParameters.description:
an xml sequence consisting of child elements of elements in `x`; if `nm`
 is `()`, returns a sequence of all such elements;
 otherwise, include only elements whose expanded name is `nm`
This is equivalent to `children(x).elements(nm)`.

functions.name: elementChildren
functions.description: Selects element children of an xml value

parameters.name: nm
parameters.description: the expanded name of the elements to be selected, or `()` for all elements

returnParameters.description:
an xml sequence consisting of all the element items in `x` whose expanded name is `nm`,
 or, if `nm` is `()`, all element items in `x`

functions.name: elements

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a predicate to apply to each item to test whether it should be selected

returnParameters.description: new xml sequence containing items in `x` for which `func` evaluates to true

functions.name: filter
functions.description:
Selects the items from an xml sequence for which a function returns true.
Each item is represented as a singleton value.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each item in `x`

functions.name: forEach
functions.description:
Applies a function to each item in an xml sequence.
Each item is represented as a singleton value.

returnParameters.description: xml value resulting from parsing `s`, or an error

functions.name: fromString
functions.description:
Constructs an xml value from a string.
This parses the string using the `content` production of the
XML 1.0 Recommendation.

returnParameters.description: the item with index `i` in `x`

functions.name: get
functions.description:
Returns the item of `x` with index `i`.
This differs from `x[i]` in that it panics if
`x` does not have an item with index `i`.

returnParameters.description: attributes of `x`

functions.name: getAttributes
functions.description:
Returns the map representing the attributes of `elem`.
This includes namespace attributes.
The keys in the map are the expanded names of the attributes.

returnParameters.description: children of `elem`

functions.name: getChildren
functions.description: Returns the children of `elem`.

returnParameters.description: the content of `x`

functions.name: getContent
functions.description: Returns the content of a text or processing instruction or comment item.

returnParameters.description: element name

functions.name: getName
functions.description: Returns a string giving the expanded name of `elem`.

returnParameters.description: target part of `x`

functions.name: getTarget
functions.description: Returns the target part of the processing instruction.

returnParameters.description:
iterator object
Each item is represented by an xml singleton.

functions.name: iterator
functions.description: Returns an iterator over the xml items of `x`

returnParameters.description: number of XML items in `x`

functions.name: length
functions.description: Returns number of xml items in `x`.

parameters.name: children
parameters.description: xml or string to set as children

functions.name: setChildren
functions.description:
Sets the children of `elem` to `children`.
This panics if it would result in the element structure
becoming cyclic.

functions.name: setName
functions.description: Change the name of element `elem` to `xName`.

returnParameters.description: a subsequence of `x` consisting of items with index >= startIndex and < endIndex

functions.name: slice
functions.description: Returns a subsequence of an xml value.

returnParameters.description: `x` with insignificant parts removed

functions.name: strip
functions.description:
Strips the insignificant parts of the an xml value.
Comment items, processing instruction items are considered insignificant.
After removal of comments and processing instructions, the text is grouped into
the biggest possible chunks (i.e. only elements cause division into multiple chunks)
and a chunk is considered insignificant if the entire chunk is whitespace.

constants.name: base
constants.description: The expanded name of the `xml:base` attribute.

constants.name: lang
constants.description: The expanded name of the `xml:lang` attribute.

constants.name: space
constants.description: The expanded name of the `xml:space` attribute.

constants.name: XML_NAMESPACE_URI
constants.description: The namespace URI bound to the `xml` prefix.

constants.name: XMLNS_NAMESPACE_URI
constants.description: The namespace URI bound to the `xmlns` prefix.

types.name: ItemType
types.description:
A type parameter that is a subtype of any singleton or empty xml sequence.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.

modules.summary: This module facilitates developers to write automation tests for ballerina code in a simple manner. It provides a number of capabilities such as configuring setup and cleanup steps in different levels, ordering and grouping of tests, providing value-sets to tests and independence from external functions and endpoints via mocking capabilities.

functions.name: assertEquals
functions.description: Asserts whether the given values are equal. If it is not, an AssertError is thrown with the given errorMessage.

functions.name: assertExactEquals
functions.description: Asserts whether the given values are exactly equal. If it is not, an AssertError is thrown with the given errorMessage.

functions.name: assertFail
functions.description: Assert failure is triggered based on user discretion. AssertError is thrown with the given errorMessage.

functions.name: assertFalse
functions.description: Asserts whether the given condition is false. If it is not, a AssertError is thrown with the given errorMessage.

functions.name: assertNotEquals
functions.description: Asserts whether the given values are not equal. If it is equal, an AssertError is thrown with the given errorMessage.

functions.name: assertNotExactEquals
functions.description: Asserts whether the given values are not exactly equal. If it is equal, an AssertError is thrown with the given errorMessage.

functions.name: assertTrue
functions.description: Asserts whether the given condition is true. If it is not, a AssertError is thrown with the given errorMessage.

parameters.name: errorMessage
parameters.description: Custom message for the ballerina error

returnParameters.description: an AssertError with custom message and category

functions.name: createBallerinaError
functions.description: Creates an AssertError with custom message and category.

langLibs.name: test
langLibs.summary: This module facilitates developers to write automation tests for ballerina code in a simple manner. It provides a number of capabilities such as configuring setup and cleanup steps in different levels, ordering and grouping of tests, providing value-sets to tests and independence from external functions and endpoints via mocking capabilities.
